mim.name: ECIM_CommonLibrary
mim.description: ECIM Common Library is a Common model fragment. ECIM Common Library's MOM entities used by 2+ ECIM fragments are stored.

struct.name: AsyncActionProgress
struct.description: Records the progress of an asynchronous action.

structMember.name: actionName
structMember.description: Name of the invoked asynchronous action.

structMember.name: additionalInfo
structMember.description: Used for logging significant messages during execution of an action.

structMember.name: progressInfo
structMember.description: Textual information that describes the actual state of the action execution.

structMember.name: progressPercentage
structMember.description: Progress of the action. The range is between 0 and 100.

structMember.name: result
structMember.description: Result state of a completed action. This field has value NOT_AVAILABLE if the action is not finished.

structMember.name: resultInfo
structMember.description: Textual description of the outcome/result of the action containing useful information for the NMS. If the action failed, it can contain an error message.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: Current state of the action.

structMember.name: actionId
structMember.description: Uniquely identifies the invocation of an action. Identifies the invocation of an action when the managed object allows invocation of more than one action at a time.

structMember.name: timeActionStarted
structMember.description: Date and time when the current action was started.

structMember.name: timeActionCompleted
structMember.description: Date and time when the action was completed (successfully or unsuccessfully).

structMember.name: timeOfLastStatusUpdate
structMember.description: Date and time when the struct member state was last updated.

structMember.name: cleartext
structMember.description: Indicates whether or not the password is entered in cleartext.

structMember.name: password
structMember.description: Holds the password or passphrase text.

struct.name: ProductIdentity
struct.description: Deprecated, Contains product information for a Managed Element and ManagedFunction(s). Replaced by ProductData

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description: The product number in Ericsson ABC format. For information, refer to Ericsson Corporate Basic Standards.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description: The product revision in the form R[1-9][A-Z]. For information, refer to Ericsson Corporate Basic Standards.

structMember.name: productDesignation
structMember.description: Common product name.

struct.name: ProductData
struct.description: Represents an Ericsson software product. The product name, product number, and product revision represent product information stored in PRIM realization part.

structMember.name: productName
structMember.description: Name of the product.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description: Product number of the product.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description: Revision state of the product.

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description: Production date of the product.

structMember.name: description
structMember.description: Free text description of the product.

structMember.name: type
structMember.description: Free text description of the product type.

enum.name: DayOfWeekOccurrence
enum.description: The occurrence of a day in the month, for example the first Monday of the month. This is used in combination with DayOfWeek to schedule an event on a certain occurence of that day in the month, for example first Monday or last Friday of the month.

enumMember.name: FIRST
enumMember.description: First occurrence.

enumMember.name: SECOND
enumMember.description: Second occurrence.

enumMember.name: THIRD
enumMember.description: Third occurrence.

enumMember.name: FOURTH
enumMember.description: Fourth occurrence.

enumMember.name: LAST
enumMember.description: Last occurrence.

enumMember.name: ALL
enumMember.description: All occurrences.

enum.name: DayOfWeek
enum.description: Presents the day of the week.

enumMember.name: SUNDAY
enumMember.description: Sunday.

enumMember.name: MONDAY
enumMember.description: Monday.

enumMember.name: TUESDAY
enumMember.description: Tuesday.

enumMember.name: WEDNESDAY
enumMember.description: Wednesday.

enumMember.name: THURSDAY
enumMember.description: Thursday.

enumMember.name: FRIDAY
enumMember.description: Friday.

enumMember.name: SATURDAY
enumMember.description: Saturday.

enumMember.name: ALL
enumMember.description: All days.

enum.name: ActionResultType
enum.description: Lists the different results of an action.

enumMember.name: SUCCESS
enumMember.description: The asynchronous action ended with success.

enumMember.name: FAILURE
enumMember.description: The asynchronous action ended with failure.

enumMember.name: NOT_AVAILABLE
enumMember.description: No result is available yet.

enumMember.name: CANCELLING
enumMember.description: Cancellation is in progress.

enumMember.name: RUNNING
enumMember.description: The execution of the action is currently in progress.

enumMember.name: FINISHED
enumMember.description: The action is finished.

enumMember.name: CANCELLED
enumMember.description: The action has been cancelled and cancellation has been done.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: Use of the resource is administratively permitted to existing instances of use only. While the system remains in the shutting down state the manager may at any time cause the managed object to revert to the locked state.

enum.name: BasicAdmState
enum.description: Basic administrative states for a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

enum.name: SchemaFormat
enum.description: Schema formats of the supported data models.

enumMember.name: MP_DTD
enumMember.description: The data model format is XML based on mp.dtd.

enumMember.name: GZIP
enumMember.description: GNU zip file compression type.

enum.name: AvailabilityStatus
enum.description: Deprecated, The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value. replaced by AvailStatus.

enumMember.name: NO_STATUS
enumMember.description: The resource is fully operational. The operational state is enabled.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down, normal users are precluded from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on. For example, either a fuse or some other protection device has removed power, or a low voltage condition has been detected. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed. This operation is to place the resource online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by an internal control process. Inactive is done in accordance with a predetermined time schedule. Under normal conditions the control process can be expected to reactivate the resource at some scheduled time, and it is therefore considered to be optional. The operational state is enabled or disabled.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: Indicates a log full condition. The semantics are defined in CCITT Rec. X.735 | ISO/IEC 10164-6.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable. For example, a device is not accessible because its controller is powered off. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete. For example, a plug-in unit is missing, a cable is disconnected, or a software module is not loaded. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed. The operational state is disabled.

enum.name: BasicAvailabilityStatus
enum.description: Deprecated, The basic availability status is used to define the truly common operational state. Replaced by BasicAvailStatus.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable. For example, a device is not accessible because its controller is powered off. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating. The operational state is disabled.

enum.name: AvailStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down, normal users are prevented from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed. This routine operation is to place the resource online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by an internal control process.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: Indicates a log full condition. The semantics are defined in CCITT Rec. X.735 | ISO/IEC 10164-6.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down.

enum.name: BasicAvailStatus
enum.description: Truly common available status required to qualify the operational state.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because of its dependency on other resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

enum.name: UsageState
enum.description: The usage state describes the usage of a resource. The allowed values are defined by ITU-T X.731.

enumMember.name: IDLE
enumMember.description: The resource is not currently in use. Defined by ITU-T X.731

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The resource is in use and it has sufficient spare operating capacity. Spare operating capacity to provide for additional users simultaneously. Defined by ITU-T X.731

enumMember.name: BUSY
enumMember.description: The resource is in use, but it has no spare operating capacity. Spare operating capacity to provide for additional users at this instant. Defined by ITU-T X.731

derivedDataType.name: Time
derivedDataType.description: Represents the international standard for the representation of local time (ISO 8601). The following pattern describes the Time format: hh:mm:ss Where: hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed)

derivedDataType.name: DayOfMonth
derivedDataType.description: Represents a day in the month in digits. The string format is "D" or "DD"(excluding quotes). D or DD = One or two digit day (1 through 31) 0 denotes all days.

derivedDataType.name: Month
derivedDataType.description: Represents a month in digits. The string format is "M" or "MM" (excluding quotes). M or MM = One or two digit month (1 or 0 1=January, and so on) 0 denotes all months.

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part, a time part, and an optional time zone information part. The time zone part may be a "Z", representing the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone (equals to +00) or a time zone offset (for example, +02:00). If the time zone part is not present, the DateTime value represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = Time is UTC +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted as follows: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

derivedDataType.name: DateTimeWithoutOffset
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of local date and time (ISO 8601). The following pattern describes the DateTimeWithoutOffset format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second
DateTimeWithoutOffset values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTimeWithoutOffset format is further restricted as follows: - T designator is upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

derivedDataType.name: IpDNSAddress
derivedDataType.description: The IpDNSAddress type represents an IP address or a DNS domain name. A version 4 IP address is specified in dotted quad notation, for example 130.100.92.154. RFC 791 describes the syntax in detail. A version 6 IP address is specified by 8 groups of 16 bit hexadecimal values separated by colons, for example, 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334. RFC 4291 describes the syntax in detail. A DNS name is specified as a fully qualified domain name, for example, myhost.ericsson.com. The internet domain is loosely specified but RFC 1034 recommends a syntax.

derivedDataType.name: DifferenceFromUTC
derivedDataType.description:
Time zone difference between the local current time and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The format is as follows: [+/-]hh:mm
It is expressed as positive (that is, with the leading plus sign [+]) if the local time is ahead of or equal to UTC of day and as negative (that is, with the leading minus sign [-]) if it is behind the UTC of day. Example: +01:00

derivedDataType.name: EcimEmpty
derivedDataType.description: Represents a leaf that has no value, it conveys information by its presence or absence.

derivedDataType.name: DistinguishedName
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of Distinguished Name (RFC 4517). The DistinguishedName syntax is defined in RFC4517. The string representation of the Distinguished Name structure is as follows:
distinguishedName = [ relativeDistinguishedName ( COMMA relativeDistinguishedName ) ] relativeDistinguishedName = attributeTypeAndValue ( PLUS attributeTypeAndValue ) attributeTypeAndValue = attributeType EQUALS attributeValue attributeType = descr/numericoid attributeValue = string/hexstring

derivedDataType.name: Date
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date (ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DD" (excluding quotes).
The following pattern describes the Date format: YYYY-MM-DD Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31)

derivedDataType.name: Port
derivedDataType.description: Represents Internet Assigned Numbers Authority(IANA) standards port number valid from 0 to 65535.

derivedDataType.name: ActionInvocationResult
derivedDataType.description: This is the datatype for the Asychronous Action Id.

class.name: ManagedObject
class.description: The ManagedObject MO represents a generic MO type. It does not represent any real resource in the system and can therefore not be instanciated. It is used as a MO-reference that can refer to multiple MO types.
